intro: Monardella glauca, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and clusters of blue-violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry meadows and open woodlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, fuzzy hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Monardella glauca is valued in gardens for its ornamental beauty and ability to attract pollinators like butterflies and bees.
